questionTitle: Which of the following is a virtual machine technology now owned by Oracle that can run various operating systems?
questionExplanation: VirtualBox serves as a host for a variety of virtual appliances.

questionOption1: JumpIt is an open-source virtual appliance installation and management service
questionOption2: Converting a virtual appliance from one platform to another is easy proposition
questionOption3: Nearly all major virtualization platform vendors support OVF, notably VMware, Microsoft, Oracle, and Citrix
questionExplanation: Efforts are underway to create file format standards for these types of objects that make the task easier.

questionTitle: Which of the following lets a Web service advertise itself in terms of a collection of endpoints?
questionExplanation: The most commonly used model for discovery and description used with SOAP messaging is the Web Services Description Language (WSDL).

questionTitle: Which of the following is a specification for multicast discovery on a LAN?
questionExplanation: WS-Discovery stands for Web Services Dynamic Discovery specification.

questionOption1: Cloud computing arises from services available over the Internet communicating
questionOption2: XML-RPC uses platform-independent XML data to encode program calls that are transported over HTTP
questionOption3: SOAP uses JSON for its messages and uses RPC and HTTP for message passing
questionExplanation: SOAP forms the basis for most of the Web services stacks.

questionTitle: _________ as a Service is a cloud computing infrastructure that creates a development environment upon which applications may be build.
questionExplanation: PaaS provides a model that can be used to create or augment complex applications such as Customer Relation Management (CRM) or Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems.

questionTitle: _________ is a cloud computing service model in which hardware is virtualized in the cloud.
questionExplanation: In this particular model, the service vendor owns the equipment: servers, storage, network infrastructure, and so forth.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the fundamental unit of virtualized client in an IaaS deployment?
questionExplanation: A workload simulates the ability of a certain type of real or physical server to do any amount of work.

questionTitle: How many types of virtual private server instances are partitioned in an IaaS stack?
questionExplanation: The three workloads require three different sizes of computers: small, medium, and large.

questionTitle: Which of the following correctly represents cloud computing ecosystem?
questionOption1:
Business Process
Application Services
Platform Services
Infrastructure Services
questionOption2:
Application Process
Business Services
Platform Services
Infrastructure Services
questionOption3:
Application Process
Infrastructure Services
Platform Services
Infrastructure Services
questionOption4:
Business Process
Application Services
Infrastructure Services
Platform Services
questionExplanation: You can broadly partition cloud computing into four layers that form a cloud computing ecosystem.
